data_structures: two lists (acting as stacks for left and right of cursor)
algorithm_technique: Two stacks for cursor management and text manipulation
problem_summary_simple: Create a text editor with cursor movement, text addition, and deletion.
problem_summary_technical: Uses two stacks (left and right of cursor) to simulate text and cursor position, enabling O(k) operations for cursor movement and deletion.
time_complexity: ctor: O(1), addText: O(L), deleteText: O(k), cursorLeft: O(k), cursorRight: O(k)
key_insights: Representing the text as two stacks (left and right of the cursor) is an elegant way to handle cursor movement and modifications.
Adding text appends to the left stack. Deleting text pops from the left stack.
Cursor movement involves popping from one stack and pushing to the other, ensuring the cursor stays within bounds.
